     ÃƒÂº  BAND INFO

     ÃƒÂº  THIS IS THE NEW DRAGONFORCE ALBUM, NOT THE DEMO!!!
     ÃƒÂº
     ÃƒÂº  London's DRAGONFORCE (formerly called DragonHeart),
     ÃƒÂº  released their incredible demo 'Valley of the
     ÃƒÂº  Damned' back in June 2000, taking the metal
     ÃƒÂº  underground/internet by storm. Number 1 on mp3.com's
     ÃƒÂº  power metal chart for over 2 years beating major
     ÃƒÂº  band like Blind Guaridan. As an unsigned band, they
     ÃƒÂº  already toured with Halford, Stratovarius, and
     ÃƒÂº  finally signed a deal with Sanctuary early this year
     ÃƒÂº  (Iron Maiden, Helloween). Now they are back with
     ÃƒÂº  their long awaited debut album to take on the metal
     ÃƒÂº  world beyond the net!!!
     ÃƒÂº
     ÃƒÂº  This is the best power metal debut for a long time,
     ÃƒÂº  or maybe even the best PM album of 2003. The guitars
     ÃƒÂº  are absolutely insane, as well as really good songs
     ÃƒÂº  through out the CD with a great singer!
     ÃƒÂº  They call themselves 'Catchty Speed Power Metal' you
     ÃƒÂº  will know why after a listen, break neck speed not
     ÃƒÂº  for pussies! ;)
     ÃƒÂº
     ÃƒÂº  There are rumours flying around, the CDs in the
     ÃƒÂº  shops will contain many hidden music video not on
     ÃƒÂº  this promo, so this is the one to buy after your
     ÃƒÂº  x-mas holidays!
     ÃƒÂº
     ÃƒÂº  More info on the band including DiVX videos to

     ÃƒÂº  NOTE TO NEWBIES/NEW FANS

     ÃƒÂº  A lot of people might be getting confused with this
     ÃƒÂº  release! Five of the songs here were released on

     ÃƒÂº  DragonHeart which are still available on mp3.com to

     ÃƒÂº
     ÃƒÂº  All the 5 songs of the demo have been re-recorded
     ÃƒÂº  and sound even better.
     ÃƒÂº
     ÃƒÂº  All rips here are from the album promo, not the

     ÃƒÂº  around from Brazil, they are not the same band so
     ÃƒÂº  don't get confused with their albums and
     ÃƒÂº  DragonForce's :)
     ÃƒÂº
     ÃƒÂº  ----------------------------------------------------
     ÃƒÂº  OFFICIAL PROMO BIOGRAPHY
     ÃƒÂº  ----------------------------------------------------
     ÃƒÂº  Well-know in the underground for years, it is now
     ÃƒÂº  time for Dragonforce to finally deliver their first
     ÃƒÂº  full-length release due out in stores on January
     ÃƒÂº  20th, 2003.  The album is being released on the
     ÃƒÂº  'Noise Records' label.
     ÃƒÂº
     ÃƒÂº  DragonForce is somewhat of a rarity, based in London
     ÃƒÂº  England, they play a brand of music that is almost
     ÃƒÂº  non-existent in their location. Formed in September
     ÃƒÂº  1999, formerly known as DragonHeart, the band
     ÃƒÂº  changed their name in December 2001 to DragonForce
     ÃƒÂº  to avoid confusion with other bands, record labels
     ÃƒÂº  and movies under the same name.
     ÃƒÂº
     ÃƒÂº  The band is powered by the twin guitar assaults of
     ÃƒÂº  Herman Li and Sam Totman, with singer ZP Theart,
     ÃƒÂº  drummer Didier Almouzni, and keyboard player Vadim
     ÃƒÂº  Pruzhanov. An ordinary line up it may seem at first,
     ÃƒÂº  but DragonForce is uniquely backed by a diverse,
     ÃƒÂº  multi-culture international line up (Hong Kong,
     ÃƒÂº  England, South Africa, France, Ukraine) never seen
     ÃƒÂº  before from a young new band.
     ÃƒÂº
     ÃƒÂº  In short, DragonForce's sound can be best described
     ÃƒÂº  as a mix of modern melodic power metal with the fury
     ÃƒÂº  of speed metal, but the band's influence comes from
     ÃƒÂº  wide across the metal spectrum. Catchy melodies that
     ÃƒÂº  stick straight into your head, combined with
     ÃƒÂº  outrageous speed, power and totally over the top
     ÃƒÂº  dual guitar wizardry are just some of their
     ÃƒÂº  qualities which separate them from the masses. Most
     ÃƒÂº  importantly underneath this sonic fury lies the
     ÃƒÂº  band's indisputable strength, their song writing.
     ÃƒÂº  Take any of their songs and you will find enough
     ÃƒÂº  hooks to fill an ocean, enough technical process to
     ÃƒÂº  satisfy progressive metal lovers, guitar solos to
     ÃƒÂº  have you playing air guitar combined with catchy
     ÃƒÂº  melodies and the strong voice of an outstanding
     ÃƒÂº  metal shouter.
     ÃƒÂº
     ÃƒÂº  Well known in the underground, DragonForce has
     ÃƒÂº  already toured with Halford, Stratovarius, Virgin
     ÃƒÂº  Steele and successfully headlined their own show
     ÃƒÂº  across England without an album out then. Previously
     ÃƒÂº  known simply by the word of mouth among metal fans,
     ÃƒÂº  and their songs on mp3 through the internet, the
     ÃƒÂº  band is now more than ready to take on the world
     ÃƒÂº  with their long awaited debut album 'Valley of the
     ÃƒÂº  Damned'.
     ÃƒÂº
     ÃƒÂº  'Valley of the Damned' was recorded in 3 different
     ÃƒÂº  locations between May and October 2002. The drums
     ÃƒÂº  were recorded at Jailhouse Studio in Denmark with
     ÃƒÂº  producer Tommy Hansen (Helloween), further
     ÃƒÂº  recordings took place at Thin Ice Studios with
     ÃƒÂº  producer/guitarist Karl Groom (Threshold) and at
     ÃƒÂº  band guitarist Herman Li's home studio.  The album
     ÃƒÂº  truly shows the band's talent from performance, song
     ÃƒÂº  writing, all the way to production!

     ÃƒÅ¡Ã‚Â¿
    ÃƒÅ¡Ã‚Â¿Ã‚Â³
ÃƒÂºÃƒÂ¹ Ãƒâ€žÃƒâ‚¬Ã‚Â³Ãƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€ž Ãƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€žÃƒâ€ž  ÃƒÂ¹    ÃƒÂº
     Ã‚Â³Ã‚Â³
  ÃƒÂºÃƒÂ¹Ãƒâ€ž|Ãƒâ„¢ A.M.R.C  N.E.W.S
     ÃƒÂ¹
     ÃƒÂº The 19th of May symbolized a special time for us here in
     ÃƒÂº AMRC, it was time to take a look back at when AMRC was
     ÃƒÂº born three years ago.  We've come a long way since then,
     ÃƒÂº and would thank all the people who have supported, and
     ÃƒÂº helped us in our endeavors for the past three years.
     ÃƒÂº Big greets go out to all of our friends in the scene,
     ÃƒÂº siteops who have been loyal to us, fans of metal music
     ÃƒÂº worldwide, ANY metal bands reading this nfo, and other
     ÃƒÂº metal crews in the mp3 scene.
     ÃƒÂº
     ÃƒÂº We hope you enjoy our releases which range from black
     ÃƒÂº metal to progressive rock and everything in between, a
     ÃƒÂº lot of times the bands we are interested in never get
     ÃƒÂº any attention because they aren't trying to fit into the
     ÃƒÂº current mold of mainstream music.  Regardless of what
     ÃƒÂº people at the RIAA, or the bands themselves might think,
     ÃƒÂº we don't do this to take money away from artists.  In
     ÃƒÂº fact, if anything, by releasing music from these artists,
     ÃƒÂº we hope to get them heard and potentially build up some
     ÃƒÂº interest worldwide, and would like them to develop a
     ÃƒÂº larger fanbase.
     ÃƒÂº
     ÃƒÂº If you are taking the time to read this nfo and check out
     ÃƒÂº this release, please consider the fact that the artist
     ÃƒÂº you're going to listen to probably put a lot of effort
     ÃƒÂº into releasing this piece of work.  If you really like
     ÃƒÂº the band, listen to some of their other discs, research
     ÃƒÂº them on the net, because all bands in the world have
     ÃƒÂº potential to help someone obtain the mood that they're
     ÃƒÂº searching for at any given time.  At times you hear
     ÃƒÂº people say &quot;so and so only rips lame shit&quot;, or things
     ÃƒÂº like &quot;I hate them, they suck&quot;, but keep in mind that
     ÃƒÂº everyone in the world is different, and has different
     ÃƒÂº tastes, not only in music, but in life as well. If you
     ÃƒÂº don't like something a group releases, then nobody is
     ÃƒÂº going to put a gun to your head and make you listen to
     ÃƒÂº it (unless they're fucking psychos and need psychiatric
     ÃƒÂº help), so don't put other groups down for releasing the
     ÃƒÂº music they believe in, or treat them like they have
     ÃƒÂº nothing to offer because you don't like some of their
     ÃƒÂº releases.  If they release some things that aren't for
     ÃƒÂº you, then so be it, wait until that release you've been
     ÃƒÂº waiting for does come out, and if they never release
     ÃƒÂº anything you like, there are lots of other groups out
     ÃƒÂº there for you to check out.  Let all release groups
     ÃƒÂº coexist together in peace without bashing each other
     ÃƒÂº because of differing preferences, let's keep things as
     ÃƒÂº friendly and secure as possible so that we may safely
     ÃƒÂº continue doing what we love to do in the future,
     ÃƒÂº release kickass music!
     ÃƒÂº
     ÃƒÂº Remember... an album worth listening to, is an album worth buying!
